storyTitle: As Employee, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve formal processing and approval

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission with valid data
preconditions: Employee is authenticated in the scheduling system
Employee has permission to submit schedule change requests
Supporting document (PDF/DOC) under 10MB is available for upload

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields including employee name, current schedule, requested schedule, reason for change, effective date, and attachment option

steps.action: Enter valid employee name in the employee name field
steps.expectedResult: Employee name is accepted and displayed in the field without validation errors

steps.action: Enter current schedule details (e.g., Monday-Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule details are accepted and displayed correctly

steps.action: Enter requested schedule details (e.g., Tuesday-Saturday, 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Requested schedule details are accepted and displayed correctly

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for the schedule change (e.g., 'Personal commitment requiring schedule adjustment')
steps.expectedResult: Reason is accepted and displayed in the text field

steps.action: Select a valid effective date (future date) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is selected and displayed in correct format (MM/DD/YYYY or DD/MM/YYYY based on locale)

steps.action: Click on the attachment button and select a valid document (e.g., medical certificate, 2MB PDF)
steps.expectedResult: Document is uploaded successfully, file name and size are displayed, no error messages appear

steps.action: Review all entered data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the entered information correctly

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Request is saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table, approval workflow is initiated automatically, confirmation message is displayed with unique request ID (e.g., 'Your request #SCR-12345 has been submitted successfully'), response time is under 2 seconds

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Pending Approval'
Approval workflow is initiated and assigned to appropriate approver
Attached document is stored in DocumentStorage and linked to the request
Request ID is generated and associated with the submission
Employee can view the submitted request in their request history

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Employee is authenticated in the scheduling system
Employee has navigated to the schedule change request submission page
All mandatory fields are clearly marked with asterisks or 'required' labels

steps.action: Navigate to submission page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked as required (employee name, current schedule, requested schedule, reason, effective date)

steps.action: Leave the employee name field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty, no data is entered

steps.action: Enter valid data in current schedule field
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule data is accepted

steps.action: Leave the requested schedule field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty, no data is entered

steps.action: Enter valid reason for change
steps.expectedResult: Reason is accepted and displayed

steps.action: Leave the effective date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty, no date is selected

steps.action: Click outside the empty mandatory fields or tab to next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights missing fields with red borders or error icons, inline error messages appear (e.g., 'This field is required')

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form does not submit, error summary message is displayed at the top of the form (e.g., 'Please complete all required fields'), focus is set to the first missing mandatory field

steps.action: Verify that all empty mandatory fields are highlighted with error messages
steps.expectedResult: All missing mandatory fields (employee name, requested schedule, effective date) display individual error messages and visual indicators

postconditions: No request is saved to the database
Form remains on the submission page with entered data preserved
Error messages are clearly visible to guide user correction

testCases.title: Test attachment upload size limit enforcement
preconditions: Employee is authenticated in the scheduling system
Test file larger than 10MB (e.g., 12MB PDF) is prepared
Test file within size limit (e.g., 5MB PDF) is prepared
Employee has navigated to the schedule change request submission page

steps.action: Navigate to submission form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields including attachment upload option, size limit information is visible (e.g., 'Maximum file size: 10MB')

steps.action: Click on the attachment upload button
steps.expectedResult: File browser dialog opens allowing file selection

steps.action: Select a document larger than 10MB (e.g., 12MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog closes and system begins validation

steps.action: Observe the upload attempt
steps.expectedResult: Upload is rejected immediately, error message is displayed (e.g., 'File size exceeds maximum limit of 10MB. Please select a smaller file'), no file is attached to the form, attachment field remains empty

steps.action: Click on the attachment upload button again
steps.expectedResult: File browser dialog opens again for new selection

steps.action: Select a valid size document (e.g., 5MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: File is uploaded successfully, file name and size are displayed in the attachment field (e.g., 'medical_certificate.pdf (5MB)'), no error messages appear

steps.action: Complete all other mandatory fields with valid data (employee name, current schedule, requested schedule, reason, effective date)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid data without errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission succeeds, request is saved with attachment linked, approval workflow is initiated, confirmation message with request ID is displayed, attached document is stored in DocumentStorage API

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with valid attachment
Attachment file is stored in DocumentStorage and associated with the request ID
Employee receives confirmation with request ID
Oversized file is not stored in the system
